00068 #define QUIT(x)         {fprintf x; exit(-1);}

00070 ad_rec_t *
00071 ad_open_dev(const char *dev, int32 sps)
00072 {
00073     ad_rec_t *r;
00074 
00075     if ((r = (ad_rec_t *) calloc(1, sizeof(ad_rec_t))) == NULL)
00076         return NULL;
00077 
00078     if (dev == NULL)
00079         dev = DEFAULT_DEVICE;
00080     r->audio_fd = audioOpen(dev, (int) sps);
00081     r->recording = 0;
00082 
00083     return r;
00084 }
00085 
00086 ad_rec_t *
00087 ad_open_sps(int32 sps)
00088 {
00089     return ad_open_dev(DEFAULT_DEVICE, sps);
00090 }
00091 
00092 ad_rec_t *
00093 ad_open(void)
00094 {
00095     return ad_open_dev(DEFAULT_DEVICE, DEFAULT_SAMPLES_PER_SEC);
00096 }

00098 int32
00099 ad_start_rec(ad_rec_t * r)
00100 {
00101     if (r->recording)
00102         return -1;
00103 
00104     audioStartRecord();
00105     r->recording = 1;
00106 
00107     return 0;
00108 }

00110 
00111 int32
00112 ad_stop_rec(ad_rec_t * r)
00113 {
00114     if (!r->recording)
00115         return -1;
00116 
00117     audioStopRecord();
00118     r->recording = 0;
00119 
00120     return 0;
00121 }

00124 int32
00125 ad_read(ad_rec_t * r, int16 * buf, int32 max)
00126 {
00127     int32 len;
00128 
00129     /* Get whatever samples are available, upto max requested size */
00130     len = max * AD_SAMPLE_SIZE;
00131     len = read(r->audio_fd, buf, len);
00132 
00133     if (len > 0) {
00134         /* HACK!!  Assume read returns complete samples, but check the assumption */
00135         if (len & 0x1)
00136             QUIT((stderr,
00137                   "%s(%d): **ERROR**, ad_read() returned odd #bytes\n",
00138                   __FILE__, __LINE__));
00139 
00140         return (len >> 1);
00141     }
00142 
00143     if ((len == 0) && (!r->recording))
00144         return -1;              /* EOF */
00145 
00146     return 0;
00147 }

00150 int32
00151 ad_close(ad_rec_t * r)
00152 {
00153     if (r->recording)
00154         ad_stop_rec(r);
00155 
00156     audioClose();
00157     free(r);
00158 
00159     return 0;
00160 }
